title: Integrated Curriculum Design for Multidisciplinary Social Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational social science theories and basic principles related to professional fields
context.additional_context: Multidisciplinary collaboration competency for solving social issues, targeting professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields.

learning_goals: Learners construct a social issue analysis framework (e.g., climate change policy conflicts) by connecting three or more core concepts from economics, politics, and the environment. They write a report meeting a five-step evaluation checklist (problem definition, concept connection, alternative generation, action plan, evaluation criteria).

In three-member teams, learners apply three or more role-division strategies when designing an interprofessional collaboration system. Within two weeks, they submit a project plan (role definitions, communication protocols, risk management) tailored to real workplace scenarios (e.g., hospitals/construction sites).
Propose data-driven solutions to social problems using digital tools
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
